check out what palipsest says about it. System -> Administration -> Disk Utility

it gives a clear SMART report, bad sector count, and everything.
so if smart says the hard drive has got a bad sector than i can send my hard drive back?
I guess so, yeah. A brand new drive should NOT have any bad sector.
if SMART says it's fine, then you might just have to zero the drive entirely, and repartition it.
I am not sure if dd copies the bad sectors too, and the "good" hard drive thinks that it´s broken

if SMART says there are bad sectors, then they are MARKED as bad sectors. But what gparted tells you is that there's corrupted data on the ntfs partition, which could be caused by dd'ing from a faulty disk
so if I delete the content from the new hard drive and use dd_rescue it could work again?
yep! There's a good chance! But before that just take a look at the SMART report to make sure your new disk is healthy.
But windows should repair itself by chkdsk /f /r or not?
chkdsk would have trouble repairing dd'ed datas. ddrescue'ed on the other hand are a bit more complete, so it'll be repairable by chkdsk
